You should focus on Water management

 Illustration of pumpkins (both green and orange) growing on straw mulch. Mulch (either straw or plastic) prevents pathogens from splashing up from the soil when it rains. 

Illustration of black drip irrigation lines running through a field of various vegetables, connected to a larger PVC irrigation line. Use drip irrigation when possible to add water near the roots of plants without splashing water onto the leaves. 

Illustration of beans supported by a trellis. Proper spacing and the use of trellises for to support vertical growth provide better airflow through the canopy. 

Illustration of green shrubs on a grassy slope between two fields. Grassy walkways between plots can prevent water movement across fields. In areas with slopes, use deep-rooted perennials to absorb water.
